conclusion: To determine the charge amount of the small ball, consider the forces when voltage U is applied.
Initially, the ball falls vertically under gravity. Voltage introduces an electric force causing motion along BC.
The ball moves along trajectory BC making a 45° angle with the vertical.
Gravitational force G acts downward with magnitude mg.
Electric force Fe acts horizontally due to the electric field between the plates.
Electric field E is given by E = U/d.
The ball moves at a 45° angle, implying horizontal and vertical force components are equal.
Electric force is given by Fe = qE.
Solving for charge q: q = mgd/U.
The charge amount of the small ball is q = Gd/U.
